meanings.definition: A large African antelope with a reddish-brown coat and curved horns.
meanings.sent1: The sassaby gracefully roamed the savannah.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a sassaby while on a safari in Africa.
meanings.sent3: The sassaby decided to show off its beautiful horns to the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Among the antelopes, the sassaby stood out like a majestic painting.
meanings.sent5: The reddish-brown coat of the sassaby shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To behave in a bold, cheeky, or impudent manner.
meanings.sent1: She likes to sassaby her way through conversations.
meanings.sent2: Don't sassaby your elders; show respect.
meanings.sent3: The child decided to sassaby the teacher by talking back.
meanings.sent4: His friends were amused by his ability to sassaby without getting in trouble.
meanings.sent5: When feeling confident, she tends to sassaby a bit too much.
